intro: Icica tacamahaca, commonly known as the sacred tree of the Maya, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a fibrous, spongy fruit that contains seeds enclosed in a soft, fleshy pulp. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its cultural significance, it is also known as the "tree of life" in some indigenous traditions.
